appearances.snippet: i want to play you a clip from tuesday, senator kevin cramer talking about what could happen if jerome powell says he would resign. appearances.title: ABC7 News 3:00PM : KGO : January 12, 2026 3:00pm-3:30pm PST
appearances.snippet: . >> republican senators lisa murkowski, kevin cramer and thom tillis are breaking with the administrationllis writes, quote, if there were any remaining doubt whether advisers within the trump administration are actively pushing to end the independence of the federal reserve, there should now be none. tillis is a member of the senate banking committee, and vows to oppose the confirmation of any nominee for the fed as long as this case is pending. christiane cordero, abc news, washington. >> there's outrage over the federal government's response to the deadly ice shooting in minneapolis last week. demonstrations are picking up all across the country. state and city authorities say protests remain peaceful overall, despite heated confrontations and arrests. over the weekend. federal agents used a battering ram on one home, also in minneapolis, and later took a man away in handcuffs. the white house doubled down on its support for ice operations and even for the fatal shooting. >> this administration will continue to stand wholeheartedly by the brave men and women of ice, including that offi

appearances.title: PBS News Hour : KQED : January 12, 2026 3:00pm-4:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: amna: senator kevin cramer called powell a bad fed chair but added, i don't believe he is a criminal.hom tillis said he would come a quote, oppose the confirmation of any nominee for the fed including the upcoming fed chair vacancy until the legal matter is fully resolved. reaction from speaker mike johnson was definitive when asked if the doj was being weaponized. >> of course not. amna: the markets reacted. the dow dropped over 400 points after the opening bell. for more, i am joined by janet yellen. she served as chair of the federal reserve board from 2014 to 2018. the current fed chair, jerome powell, started his term immediately after her. most recently, she was treasury secretary during the biden administration. chair yellen, welcome back. >> thanks for having me. amna: you said in an interview today you believe the department of justice is being weaponized. in your words, you said to go after somebody that you don't have a valid basis to get rid of. in your view, what is the investigation really about? >> it is really about wanting to intimidate fed leadership to be able to co

appearances.title: Closing Bell : CNBC : January 13, 2026 3:00pm-4:00pm EST
appearances.snippet: i mean, tillis you've seen dave mccormick, you've seen kevin cramer, all republicans on the banking committeeat they believe that jerome powell is not guilty here, that he hasn't committed any crimes. what's been interesting to me is that even senators who i've talked to who have kind of said, look, we need to let the investigation play out or i need to learn more information. no one's really come out with full throated support for this investigation to powell. no one said it's absolutely necessary. no one said it must be done. everyone's either kind of in a wait and see posture, or they're actually coming out defending powell and really saying that this could potentially hurt the fed's independence if the executive branch was to go after the fed chair like this. >> all right. we appreciate this update. it's an important development. as we said, emily wilkins is down there on the hill, as you see. with that we'll check the market here. remember the dow is down by more than 500 points not that long ago. i was trying to get to 50,000. it's closer to 49,000 as we speak. you've had some weakness

appearances.title: CNN News Central : CNNW : January 12, 2026 11:00am-12:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: two republican, three republican senators on the record, including one who is a powell critic, kevin cramer who is sort of denounced this investigation. you have thom tillis, who said he won't confirm any fed appointee until this is done with it. sounds like lisa murkowski is in the same place. and i think that's a number that could grow. and here's the irony to this. donald trump's intent is to replace jay powell as fed chair. his term as fed chair expires in may, and yet he may create a situation where powell stays on longer. how does this happen? the republicans refuse to confirm any fed nominee until this ruse ends. and you already see a growing number of senate republicans willing to do this. look, this is where there's always been a question where are there guardrails on donald trump? the the financial markets are one of the strongest guardrails we have left, arguably more so than even than congress. congress should be a guardrail, but they have chosen, in most cases not to be. but i do think congress would. you'll see more republicans grow, grow more defensive of this position with t

appearances.title: Squawk Box Europe : CNBC : January 13, 2026 4:00am-5:00am EST
appearances.snippet: fellow senators kevin cramer and lisa murkowski have also sounded the alarm about the central bank's independence. former fed chair janet yellen, ben bernanke and alan greenspan have joined policymakers from both parties to call for the fed autonomy, calling the investigation into powell a, quote, unprecedented attempt to undermine the central bank's independence. meanwhile, the house speaker, mike johnson, said he intended to let the probe play out and not jump to any conclusions. the president, for his part, has denied any knowledge of the doj's investigation. national economic council director kevin hassett told our us colleagues that mr. trump has several issues with the fed. >> i think the president has been very vocal about what he thinks about interest rates. i don't think that there's any mystery about that, that he's frustrated that there were big cuts right before the election. he's frustrated that when he came in 2017 that there were big hikes before he's inaugurated. and so he has lots of frustration with what he views as the partizanship of the fed. but this right here i

appearances.title: The Exchange : CNBC : January 13, 2026 1:00pm-2:00pm EST
appearances.snippet: you have senators kevin cramer, dave mccormick, john kennedy all telling me and other reporters yesterday that they do not think that powell is guilty, although they have yet to go as far as saying that they will not confirm a fed nominee. another senator, lisa murkowski, has backed tillis on holding off on confirming any nominees until this investigation is over. and many other members of the banking committee i've spoken with tell me that they either need more time to understand the investigation or say the investigation needs to play out. but so far, everyone i've spoken to, none have outright supported this investigation into powell and kelly. i think that is a very interesting break that you're seeing up here among republicans on capitol hill. and president trump. >> remind us what the time frame is, emily, of when we expect this all to begin to start happening, if it is, in fact, going to happen the way that we initially thought, or if now this throws some change of plans into how it will play out. >> well, i think what would of course need to happen is for the next opening to come.

appearances.title: The Source With Kaitlan Collins : CNNW : January 13, 2026 6:00pm-7:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: first off, thoughts on kevin cramer's thinking there? well. >> that's extortion, right? i mean, that's you can't hang a criminal investigation over somebody and say, you know what? you can make this go away by going and striking a deal. so i thought that was a massive red flag to hear a senator and a. >> he said it in such a lighthearted. >> yeah, i'm not. it almost made it seem like he, he didn't understand what he was saying there. but but no that's you can't you can't threaten somebody with criminal wrongdoing and then say the way to make this go away is to is to strike a deal and just admit to it. i mean, that is textbook extortion. >> we did hear from jeanine pirro, who cnn's reporting on tonight. she was just on and talked about this investigation and the outreach that happened, basically how we got to this point. >> we started the investigation in november. on december 19th, we sent a letter, an email, and we said we'd like to talk to people at the federal reserve, give us a call. no response for ten days. december 29th, please give us a call. we'd like to talk to

appearances.snippet: in the 35 seconds he got there, one of the senators who was there that day, kevin cramer, was on ourday admitting it was a setup. >> when he was before the banking committee last year when he was asked point blank factual questions about the overruns and the elaborateness of this of his building. he pretended like he didn't know anything about a lot of these things. and we we knew the answer to the questions before they were asked, and he avoided answering them. >> so after the testimony, chair powell even followed up with a detailed letter posted publicly laying out all the renovations, the marble, the details and everything that the members of the senate banking committee wanted to know. now, fast forward to this weekend when powell came out and said, there's an investigation and he thinks it's really about punishing him for not cutting rates as much as the president wants. dc attorney general jeanine pirro, who is leading it, says powell refused to answer questions about the testimony when she asked, so inquiries were made by folks in her office, not by her directly right before c

appearances.title: Squawk on the Street : CNBC : January 13, 2026 9:00am-11:00am EST
appearances.snippet: yesterday, we were talking about thom tillis, but we also heard senator john kennedy, senator kevin cramermick all coming out against this criminal investigation by the federal government against fed chair jay powell. something i've always said is that fed chair jay powell has worked really hard to earn the respect and credibility and support on both sides of the aisle of lawmakers. remember, this is an agency that is overseen by congress, not the administration. so given some of the republican opposition here, the fact that now we're hearing her say that this is not an indictment, maybe walking it back a little bit, blinking a little bit. look, a lot of people are pointing to the market rally yesterday, carl, as evidence that the market's okay with this. but what i think it speaks more to is that there was so much condemnation on both sides of the aisle against this, that maybe it looks like that the president won't be able to carry this further, and the strategy looks like it is not working. >> that along with the the color reporting from the washington post and axios, that bessant and p

appearances.title: Chris Jansing Reports : MSNOW : January 12, 2026 9:00am-11:00am PST
appearances.snippet: senators lisa murkowski and kevin cramer and congressman mike lawler and french hill all weighing in.bowl news and an msnbc contributor. stuart stevens, chief strategist of mitt romney's 2012 campaign and senior adviser to the lincoln project, is with us as well. jake, are these five republicans outliers, or are you hearing wider discontent? >> they're outliers, but that doesn't mean it matters. but there are big impacts here for the president. number one, if enough senate republicans are upset, they could stop any new fed nominee. remember, jay powell's term is over in may. if if they can't confirm another chair, he remains the chair. the thing i keep hearing over and over again, chris, is that just it's an unforced error. and they're not not really clear what the president is getting out of this and whether the people around the president are serving his best interests, because, i mean, jay powell, again, he's not going to be whether you like him or not, he's not going to be there for that long. and the thing that was really, i think a gut punch to the president is french hill, the
